awd_titl_txt: Remote Measurement of Arctic Basin Sea Ice Thickness
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal is part of an integrated scientific investigation                 to study the properties of the Arctic ocean, atmosphere, and                    sea-ice on a transect between Murmansk, USSR and Nome, Alaska.                  It will conduct helicopter-born sea ice thickness measurements                  using a unique electromagnetic induction sounding system recently               developed for this purpose.  The survey data will be used to                    assess mean sea ice thickness and salt content in relation to                   latitude and longitude.  This information will be useful in                     providing ground-truth for satellite systems currently in use and               in providing a bench mark for sea ice motion and thermodynamic                  models.

inst.inst_name: Department of Army Cold Regions Research & Engineering Lab
